content.description: Want some mantel practice? Sit start in the front of the overhanging face of Baby Boulder, reach both of your hands up to the lip, and grab any two holds you like. Do not cheat by grab a right-facing jug over the lip. Throw a left heel up to the arete/lip, and mantel to top out the boulder.
content.location: It climbs the half moon-shaped, overhanging face of Baby Boulder.

content.description: This is smilar to Shu's Mantle, but use your right heel instead of your left heel. Sit start at the overhanging face of Baby Boulder. Reach up, and choose which ever holds you like on the lip. Do not cheat by starting with the right-facing jug behind the lip. Throw your RIGHTÂ heel up, and mantel or beach-whale to the topout.
content.location: Look for Ruth Boulder Ginsburg Boulder. This small boulder is only about 10 feet from it.

content.description: This is a small boulder near Ruth Boulder Ginsburg Boulder. This boulder is very beginner friendly.
